lenders.name: Bradley
lenders.loan_because: I want to help other business people get started.
lenders.occupational_info: Starting up a micro-philanthropy website.

lenders.name: Abbie
lenders.loan_because: We are called to help our brothers

lenders.name: Jo-G and L-No
lenders.loan_because: We started in high school with $100 and four loans--now we have made 25 loans using the same money over and over!  This is great!
lenders.occupational_info: We're in college.

lenders.name: Phil
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference
lenders.occupational_info: I work in recycling

lenders.name: ROY
lenders.occupational_info: I help find better treatments for diseases.

lenders.name: Scott
lenders.loan_because: I want to do something small to help make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Hank
lenders.loan_because: I was tired of charities that eat up donations in salaries and overhead. Kiva seems to be a very efficient and effective way to help people help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a former newspaper reporter and editor.

lenders.name: Annette
lenders.loan_because: It makes me feel good and I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with women who have become lost to themselves in the fog of addiction.

lenders.name: Tim
lenders.loan_because: People deserve a chance
lenders.occupational_info: Exciting and challenging, I love to watch a start up business grow.

lenders.name: Marlon
lenders.occupational_info: I work to better the City of New York.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed in my life in numerous ways.  We are blessed to be a blessing.  Thus, I want to share my financial blessings with others who are striving to make their way, to support themselves and their families and raising their own, and their community's, standard of living.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with organizations that want to become markedly better in all aspects of their endeavors.  I both teach and coach how to implement Lean Systems Thinking, which is modeled after the Toyota Production System.  The main objective is a total transformation of the business model into one of "product" flow, inclusiveness, transparency, respect for every person, and much greater profitability and/or system effectiveness so as to assure the future of the organization.

lenders.name: Eddie
lenders.loan_because: You can gamble in the stock market or you can try and help someone.  The amount I have given to Kiva is so small compared to the amount that has been wasted so many other places.  And the money just keeps getting recycled, it is really a joy.

lenders.name: Pat
lenders.loan_because: just a tiny payback to the Lord for taking such good care of our family.
lenders.occupational_info: Jail nurse.

lenders.name: Anne
lenders.loan_because: ...my small contribution can one day change lives. Loaning gives me the chance to show love and peace to a brother or sister in another part of the world.

lenders.name: Shane and Trish
lenders.loan_because: Life's been good to me, lending makes me feel good, and hopefully it'll help make a difference.  When I first read about Kiva I found the idea brilliant and wanted to participate. This is the way it should be done.

lenders.name: Andrew & Sarah
lenders.loan_because:
"Do not commit the error, common among the young, of assuming that if you
cannot save the whole of mankind, you have failed." -Jan de Hartog,
playwright and novelist (1914-2002)
lenders.occupational_info:
"In a completely rational society, the best of us would be teachers and the
rest of us would have to settle for something less, because passing
civilization along from one generation to the next ought to be the highest
honor and the highest responsibility anyone could have." -Lee Iacocca,
automobile executive (1924- )

lenders.name: Jeff and Gilberto
lenders.loan_because: We believe in the limitless power of the unbridled human spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: A married gay interracial couple, both of us are professional fund-raisers for non-profit civil rights and civil liberties organizations.

lenders.name: Taylor
lenders.loan_because: I believe this is something that actually works!
lenders.occupational_info: I study a lot...and basically have no life.

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: I want to give others in my country a headstart.
lenders.occupational_info: I make sure my clients use the tools they have effectively.

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because: I believe that microcredit loans are a great way to make a difference, and with Muhammad Yunus winning a Nobel Prize, and Nicholas Kristof writing about Kiva in his New York Times column, it seems very reputable. I am amazed that you can make an impact in someone's life as simply as this.
lenders.occupational_info: I am interested in wisdom and values, and try to help provide access to ideas that can improve people's lives.

lenders.name: Sidney
lenders.loan_because: I think Mohammed Yunus is a genius. I am amazed and thrilled by how well his microcredit network has worked and how it has changed the lives of so many people, mainly women (and by extension, their families.) This type of aid is very satisfying because it helps people help themselves and become self-sustaining.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an assistant professor at the University of California San Diego. I am a doctor who anesthetizes children and adults; I also teach residents and medical students.

lenders.name: Jacque
lenders.loan_because: Giving back to the world is actually how we ever really receive.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: I want to help creative and resourceful people

lenders.name: Courtney
lenders.loan_because: I read Nick Kristof's column today, and that combined with my limited knowledge of microfinance and respect for Dr. Yunus' initiative in Bangladesh made me spontaneously create this profile.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student at Tufts University majoring in international relations with a focus on economic development.  I enjoy reading, opera, and scuba diving, and my hero is Thomas Friedman.

lenders.name: Bud,Jeanne & Gram
lenders.loan_because: We are able to share. Along with our Mom, we hope to make things better.  We admire those with the guts and determination to take a risk to improve their situation
lenders.occupational_info: We are retired school personnel.  We want to give back and help those who are seeking to better themselves and their communities.

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Geraldine
lenders.loan_because: I want to give the poor the chance to live the life that we live.
lenders.occupational_info: Doing God's work!

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I was fortunate to grow up with a wonderful family that taught me the value of honesty, sincerety, and being good to others. Living in one of the richest country's in the world, the least I can do is to help someone share in that.

lenders.name: Terry
lenders.loan_because: Simply, because it is nothing but a privledge.  We can harness the power of business to do good for all!
lenders.occupational_info: I work in international development.  The foundation I work for focuses on aid through trade.

lenders.name: Perry
lenders.loan_because: such a small amount can make such a big difference.
lenders.occupational_info: Promoting fun and non-violent conflict resolution skills through baseball to children and adults all over the world.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: Thinking small is a great way to begin charity at home. I hope to one day visit one or more of my business partners.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at the local medical school.

lenders.name: Diana
lenders.loan_because: it empowers others.
lenders.occupational_info: i develop, cast and produce shows, mostly musicals.

lenders.name: Blaire
lenders.loan_because:
Having lived in Nigeria, I know first-hand how powerful a small amount of money can be in the third world. 
This is nothing short of mass cultivation of the entrepreneurial spirit.  
Let's hope its growth is exponential!
lenders.occupational_info:
In my day job, I help customers manage their documents.
I am a gemology student. 
I manufacture and sell jewelry.  
I sing in an a' cappella quartet.

lenders.name: alex
lenders.loan_because: i can
lenders.occupational_info: doing research in medical policy

lenders.name: brooklynny
lenders.loan_because: it is an incredible opportunity

lenders.name: Devin
lenders.loan_because: we're all in this together.
lenders.occupational_info: make tools for the internet.

lenders.name: Venu
lenders.loan_because: I would like to contribute my part in uplifting the poor and making the world a better place to live in.

lenders.name: Pamela
lenders.loan_because: We are so spectaculary fortunate financially in the world and with such little we can mean so much to others around the world. It makes me feel good to contribute to others and with Kiva it is not only giving but empowering someone else to create more for themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Web developer, business owner and jewelry designer. www.JuicyJewelry.com, www.WorldTravelShop.com & www.Infotask.com

lenders.name: Jeff &Laura
lenders.loan_because: This is a great opportunity to help others and we wanted to share this amazing experience with the guests at our wedding.  These loans are in their honor.

lenders.name: irene
lenders.loan_because: a simple small amount yet can make such a great improvement in others people lives living in another part of this world. The world without strangers!

lenders.name: Jim
lenders.loan_because: An open hand is so much richer than a closed fist.
lenders.occupational_info: I breathe with attention.  I teach others to listen and to breathe with mindfulness.

lenders.name: Katy
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of micro-credit loans in helping to alleviate poverty!

lenders.name: Kamael
lenders.loan_because: It's the best way to connect with the most inspiring visionaries and leaders of tomorrow's world.
lenders.occupational_info: I started a non profit focused on using mobile technology to help the ultra poor around the world.

lenders.name: Isaacs
lenders.occupational_info: I compose electronic music ( www.myspace.com/xanrecordings ) and do interaction design for the web.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: This is a simple way that I can change people's lives for the better.

lenders.name: Ina and Irwin
lenders.loan_because: I started my business with the equivalent of a micro loan and made a success of it. We understand the power of such a loan. We want others to have the same opportunity.

lenders.name: Paula
lenders.loan_because: Planting Seeds
lenders.occupational_info: Providing service to the public by assisting them in understanding and remaining in compliance with government tax laws and filing requirements.

lenders.name: Patrick
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people help themselves
lenders.occupational_info: I write

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: Traveling the world as much as I do helps me to see -first hand- the importance of helping people accomplish dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: My work finds me responsible for the safety and comfort of my passengers.  Since many passengers are affraid to fly and some have had unhappy experiences on an airplane, my job is to ease their discomfort.  I also want to make sure that the passengers who travel on my airplane arrive at their destination safely and looking forward to flying with us again.

lenders.name: The Fernie-Walsh Family
lenders.loan_because: Small business is the engine that runs the world.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: I know how difficult it is to transfer funds to most parts of the developing world. Whereas the financially established can usually obtain funding for large projects, people with good but modest ideas seem to have difficulty getting even minimal seed money. That's why I think microlending is a brilliant idea.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a historian and I teach students from age 15-19 in an international school. Although I am trained in European history, my interest has turned to world history and the many connections that have been fostered between differing cultures over time, and how people, in the bast case, learn from each other. My interest coincides with the backgrounds of my students. In my school it is not uncommon to have students from between 50-60 different countries.

lenders.name: Fadlun
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed in my life with a comfortable life although am not rich.I hold the belief that it is better to teach someone to fish rather than give the fish. I see this as my small contribution towards that end and am glad to see that the money goes to the person that I intended to help without having to go through so many red tapes where you never know whether the money reach the person you intended it for.
lenders.occupational_info: Sitting at the desk reading and vetting documents. Can be boring sometime and wished I hold some exciting job or be able to volunteer to Kiva to visit the entrepeneurs but need to work to feed the family and pay off debts.

lenders.name: Alexander
lenders.loan_because: i can and i care.

lenders.name: Sam
lenders.loan_because: It gives people the tools to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for the California Environmental Protection Agency.

lenders.name: Nicholas
lenders.loan_because: We are a very rich country that needs to continuously do more for others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a full time student.

lenders.name: wolverdick
lenders.loan_because: For so many, just a small opportunity is all they need.

lenders.name: Eline
lenders.loan_because: I want to enable other people to be self-sufficient.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a franchising company.

lenders.name: creatini
lenders.loan_because: I loan because I love to help people that they can develop they business to have a better life and to make a difference.

lenders.name: Stephane
lenders.loan_because: I want to help, and this seems like a better way to help than an outright grant. Hopefully I'll put up more money in the future.
lenders.occupational_info: I write about business for a magazine.

lenders.name: Bob
lenders.loan_because: it's a good idea. A low-overhead loan network helping small businesses around the world is one thing that the world really needs!
lenders.occupational_info: retired professor of Russian and one who worked many years in Academic Computing.

lenders.name: Carla
lenders.loan_because: We take so much for granted. Even a small loan which is so little to us means a great deal to people in need of financial resources opening doors to opportunities.
lenders.occupational_info: I was born in Michigan, live in Italy and am married with two children.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I like to feel that my donations serve individuals very directly and provide them an incentive to succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: Much of my work was helping governments and businesses in developing countries understand and work with international trade rules and negotiations.

lenders.name: canan
lenders.loan_because: I belive everyone deserves a chance to  achieve some good things in their lives and children s lives.kiva is an  amazing idea  for this. ı have   really excited when  ı  had  read about kiva in a newspaper.all of us need  other people  every second in our lives.
lenders.occupational_info: ı work for a construction  company

lenders.name: Jakob
lenders.loan_because: I am able to and I like the way micro loans work.
lenders.occupational_info: I am studying for a MS in electrical engineering.

lenders.name: Uffe
lenders.loan_because: I am able to

lenders.name: Rama and Sim
lenders.loan_because: We believe in the power of entrepreneurship, the importance of working for yourself especially in Africa where we are from.

lenders.name: Jen & Casey
lenders.loan_because: What could be better than to help people help themselves?

lenders.name: Stephan
lenders.loan_because: I strongly believe in the bottom-up approach to development aid. People on the ground know better about what needs to be done.

lenders.name: Worth
lenders.loan_because: I think this is the best way I have heard of to help people who are able to work and have spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired.  I worked as a lawyer handling trials of injured persons against companies.

lenders.name: Lian
lenders.loan_because: I think it will be interesting and inspiring to see the progress of small business owners.
lenders.occupational_info: I am studying history and theory of architecture.  I have just under a year left in my degree program (PhD).

lenders.name: Matthias BERAHYA-LAZARUS
lenders.loan_because:
I strongly believe in both entrepreneurship and micro-lending. Politicians -- especially in France -- tend to believe that 'development' or 'growth' can be forecast or self-declared... they are sadly mistaken. 

Growth comes from the will and work of courageous men & women, called entrepreneurs, who decide to invest money and start/run/develop a new business. 

I hope the money I'll provide will help generating wealth troughout the world!
lenders.occupational_info: I currently work as CEO of a new venture called Bonial, allowing users to search through local offer, brochures and catalogues on the web or on their smartphone.

lenders.name: The Wizners
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we can.  We hope to raise children who understand how to give, to lend, to share.
lenders.occupational_info: teachers, parents, readers, writers

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: I know how hard it is to get a good thing started -- banks rarely loan on a great idea and a promise to work hard!
lenders.occupational_info: I have retired and now volunteer for Crossroads   International.  We provide quality, needed items to people around the world.

lenders.name: Daniel
lenders.loan_because: it seems like a direct, tangible way of helping people improve their lives.

lenders.name: Eric
lenders.loan_because: I think that this is a great way to help the people with the most need. Seeing their pictures and knowing what they need the money for makes it more personal.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired living on a modest income, but I realise that I would seem rich to people in some areas, so I give what I can afford.

lenders.name: Ian
lenders.loan_because: I like to help those that help themselves

lenders.name: josh
lenders.loan_because: maybe you folks are on to something
lenders.occupational_info: I like to make things

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: It is justice to help others and it makes me feel good.

lenders.name: Ron
lenders.loan_because: It's nice to see that one person can make a difference a little bit at a time

lenders.name: Drew and daughter Molly
lenders.loan_because: This is the best form of foreign aid.  It is a privilege to participate.
lenders.occupational_info: I make my living buying seed from wholesale suppliers and reselling it to retail buyers.

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: The chain of helping people help themselves is stronger by the acts of giving and enabling those who are helped to assist someone else.  Giving hope is priceless.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with people who love what they do.  I use my computer and writing skills to give them a website that meets their needs for a price they can afford.

lenders.name: Eric
lenders.loan_because: It seems like a cool idea
lenders.occupational_info: I teach philosophy at a university.

lenders.name: Atticus
lenders.loan_because: I was an exchange student in Uganda many years ago and would like to help give back to the many people who extended their hospitality to me.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with local governments and school districts with their public finance matters.

lenders.name: Alexander
lenders.loan_because: No one asked to be born into poverty and we should all support those willing to work their way up.
lenders.occupational_info: I just finished 1 amazing year in Afghanistan.

lenders.name: thomas
lenders.loan_because: other people will have a shot for better life.

lenders.name: Meta
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power and empowerment of the individual.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach and I am a student of geography and environmental science.

lenders.name: Rafael
lenders.loan_because: Jehovah is my God, Christ is my saviour and the Holy Spirit is Love!

lenders.name: kimberly
lenders.loan_because: I'm fortunate enough to have the resources.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English to high school students of an online digital school!

lenders.name: Craig
lenders.loan_because: It's more rewarding than another trip to the mall.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach computers how to read English.

lenders.name: Charles
lenders.loan_because: I read about the extraordinary Muhammad Yunus, Nobel Peace Prize Winner, and his micro credit bank and this all made sense to me.  Then I read Nicholas Kristoff's great column in the New York Times about KIVA and micro credit and I knew I had to get involved.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm retired now and enjoying it some, but I remain troubled that there is so much unnecessary poverty in the world. Yunus has me convinced it is not necessary.

lenders.name: Tinman
lenders.occupational_info: I organize books and web sites so people can find information they need.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I believe that micro loans are an effective way to assist people in achieving better lives.

lenders.name: Timo
lenders.loan_because: In this world of craziness, fear and cynicism, Kiva reminds me that we all can make a positive impact on another person's life in a very real way (and be rewarded ten times over too!)
lenders.occupational_info: I am in the medical profession.

lenders.name: Talibah
lenders.loan_because: as a small business owner, I know how hard it is to raise even small bits of capital to maintain and expand a business. I would like to help others using their businessess to support their families.
lenders.occupational_info: My work is fun and rewarding, even if often solitary. When I do it well, and I try my best to do it well all the time, my work helps people to learn, grow and solve problems.

lenders.name: Lou
lenders.loan_because: I care.

lenders.name: maryellen
lenders.loan_because: I can!

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: The human family is dysfunctional, with some members having 1000s of times as much money and resources as others.  Very unhealthy state of affairs.
lenders.occupational_info: I promote wind power in the USA.  It is sustainable and clean and doesn't use water or add to global warming.

lenders.name: Cicely
lenders.loan_because: Everyone has needed a "leg up."  I am just glad that I am in a position to offer a small, but positive step towards the future.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with children who have speech/ language disabilities.  I currently work with many children who have autism.

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: I want us all to succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I make sure that people are safe and comfortable during their surgery.

lenders.name: Kathleen
lenders.loan_because: It takes so little to make a difference in someone's life.
lenders.occupational_info:
My work is like being a librarian for old photographs and documents. You can see a selection from our collections at 


www.flickr.com/photos/medicalmuseum, or at the link below.

lenders.name: Samuel
lenders.loan_because: "Samsara"

lenders.name: Richard
lenders.loan_because: we are all in this together ... one world
lenders.occupational_info: organizational psychologist .

lenders.name: Bill
lenders.loan_because: I believe in this program and enjoy watching progress being made.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an acting teacher and a playwright. I sometimes work as an actor and voice talent.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: I have traveled to Eastern Europe and the former Soviet Union and have seen the needs of these industrious people.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired University Professor who spent the last 12 years of my work teaching in many foreign countries, among them Azerbaijan, the Republic of Georgia, Poland and South Africa.

lenders.name: Diana
lenders.loan_because: this is such an efficient way to help people.  And the people-to-people connection between lender and the one receiving the loan is very special.
lenders.occupational_info: I don't work now.  I did work for our government for many years.

lenders.name: Leslie
lenders.loan_because: It's a great thing to do and helps someone else.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and build custom furniture with woods from around the world.

lenders.name: ufei
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: joan
lenders.loan_because: the need to help other people less fortunate is great and rewarding in a personal way
lenders.occupational_info: INTERESTING

lenders.name: Lyn
lenders.loan_because: maybe things don't have to fall apart. Let this be a center that holds.

lenders.name: Roger
lenders.loan_because: The need is obvious and the satisfaction is great.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired Government professional.

lenders.name: kevin
lenders.loan_because: a few folks joining to give a little money help a lot of hard-working people
lenders.occupational_info: oil and gas exploration

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: Piano Teacher

lenders.name: Deborah
lenders.loan_because:
It is so easy.  With a few clicks on our keyboards, we become connected to a new friend with a good business idea.
It is touching how diligently the business women pay back their loans.  My goal is add a new Kiva relationship a month.
lenders.occupational_info: I help figure out new ways for computers to help our company's business people.  I help design what the new software can do and then help people use it.  It's fun!

lenders.name: Roger & Dee
lenders.loan_because: "Give a man a fish; you have fed him for today.  Teach a man to fish; and you have fed him for a lifetime." - Author unknown
lenders.occupational_info: Human Resources for a major US corporation

lenders.name: Patty
lenders.loan_because: I admire hard-working people who do everything they can to be independent and help themselves.

lenders.name: Sonia
lenders.loan_because: I think Microfinance is a good idea to help people. Only $25, you can help someone to make his own living. why not?

lenders.name: Mazie
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others build better lives, especially through sustainable agriculture.

lenders.name: pat & dave
lenders.loan_because: we are able to.

lenders.name: DAVID
lenders.loan_because: The world belongs to everyone and I belong to the world
lenders.occupational_info: stay at home Dad/part time salesman

lenders.name: Sally & Phil
lenders.loan_because: although we are not Bill Gates, we too, want to help. KIVA makes it  possible.
lenders.occupational_info: We are retired. This frees me to do volunteer work in our church.  My husband runs science labs in the local community college.

lenders.name: Donald & Lilly
lenders.loan_because: We work for ourselves and we think this is a great way to help fellow capitalists. Owning your own successful business and helping others is a great gift to your community
lenders.occupational_info: We service all kinds of watches. Make parts, Complete restorations

lenders.name: Carlos
lenders.loan_because: I believe Kiva's lending concept is something that I have not seen before. It rewards those who take risks and work hard.
lenders.occupational_info: I develop software programs for a local government in South Florida.

lenders.name: Jim and Joey
lenders.loan_because: I was once a small business owner and appreciate the special energy and commitment an entrepreneur brings to his work.

lenders.name: Rose
lenders.loan_because: I like the dignity of lending to a person who may shun charity but just needs a chance. I have been given so many opportunities in my life. I also want the world to know that I am for World Peace. No wars !!
lenders.occupational_info: I counsel children and adults to help them feel better.

lenders.name: Jean & Gerry
lenders.loan_because: Helping people to help themselves is a wonderful thing.

lenders.name: Eric
lenders.loan_because: watching an entrepreneur do something productive with a few dollars of mine is more interesting than letting it sit in the bank.

lenders.name: laura
lenders.loan_because: I'm glad to help people operate their own business.

lenders.name: Teoh LayGhee Foundation
lenders.loan_because: business will make a difference in contribution financially to their family
lenders.occupational_info: being God's servant to help others whenever I can

lenders.name: Kristy
lenders.loan_because: everyone deserves a chance to be successful, happy and provide for themselves and their family.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I don't really need this little bit of money, but they do. It's also nice to donate to a person, and not a corporate edifice.
lenders.occupational_info: I study the ecology and behavior of fishes in river ecosystems.

lenders.name: Lea
lenders.loan_because: I'm learning about helping others.

lenders.name: Gregory
lenders.loan_because: Mi fa piacere aiutare chi ha bisogno
lenders.occupational_info: Commercio

lenders.name: paola e monica
lenders.loan_because: we can do

lenders.name: Sarah and Mark
lenders.loan_because: We got engaged while visiting and working in Ghana, and made a commitment to helping others as part of our life together.  We asked friends and family to join us in lending, in lieu of wedding gifts.

lenders.name: Ian
lenders.loan_because: Microcredit is a trustworthy and meaningful way to foster international development, without fears that funds will be misapplied or wasted.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a government agency.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: Although I have been doing this for years on my own (Kenya mainly), Kiva seems to have the system down pat. There is honor in helping, there is dignity in succeeding. There is a better world when both are symbiotic.
lenders.occupational_info: I help authors find publishers who will print and sell their books.

lenders.name: Lisa  & Steve
lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: curious people who love books and travel

lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: I can't do everything, but I can do something.

lenders.name: Nancy
lenders.loan_because: I loan because it works, I've been doing this for several years and I think have made a difference in people's lives. It's a good feeling.

lenders.name: GCF Fund
lenders.loan_because: I represent a group of friends who have decided to pool their money to help folks not just at the holidays but all year round. Kiva is a perfect place to acheive this goal.
lenders.occupational_info: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world: indeed, it is the only thing that ever does.- Margaret Mead

lenders.name: Ivano
lenders.loan_because: I think a chance is ......life!!!

lenders.name: nadine
lenders.occupational_info: software

lenders.name: Dan
lenders.loan_because: Entrepreneurs are good for the world, and they require funds to work.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a designer at a gaming company. I also have a couple small businesses of my own, including a custom bookplates website, and an invention called the TopoCover.

lenders.name: Eric & Gretchen
lenders.loan_because: what is a small amount of money to us can change someone else's future.

lenders.name: Fang
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a great way to encourage economic development.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a PhD student in labor and development economics.  My research involves education and labor issues in developing countries, especially India and China.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: It is a privilege to share some of my resources with others across the world who simply need a bit of support to make better lives for themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: For 20 years I worked in non profit fund raising and communications for a U.S. charity.  In May, 2010, after three grueling years of law school, I earned a Juris Doctorate.  Currently, I work as an international tour operator, helping build bridges of understanding through travel.

lenders.name: Wallis
lenders.occupation: Consultant to the clinical research industry

lenders.name: Sara
lenders.loan_because: It is one small thing I can do to help out someone who is trying to get ahead in the world and is not supported by big business.  I think this small action can give someone a helping hand and make a big difference in their life.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an instructor in the Department of Kinesiology at Kansas State University.  I specialize in Cardiopulmonary physiology and will have my PhD in 2009 or 2010.

lenders.name: Greg S.
lenders.loan_because: It makes me feel good. And I believe at least in this case, a loan can do more than a gift. This is something anyone can do and everyone should do.
lenders.occupational_info: Attorney

lenders.name: Glen Galindo
lenders.loan_because: People who work hard and contribute to their community should be supported.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a graduate student studying how to manage globalization of higher education. Everything dealing with student study-abroad programs, faculty exchange and multi-national campus development.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: I believe helping people who already have an idea about how to improve their lot is the best way to improve their lives, leave them in charge.
lenders.occupational_info: I now volunteer in the financial management of my church.

lenders.name: james
lenders.loan_because: It is in giving that we receive. It is as simple as that.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people solve personal legal problems.

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: It empowers people to do what they dream of doing.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a non-profit organization that is trying to rehabilitate abandoned gas stations and turn them in to community centers and green spaces.

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: it's so easy, it'd be a crime not to.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the marketing department of a security technology company.

lenders.name: Kathy and Yvonne
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we want people to be as happy as we are and to have the same opportunities in life with which we have been blessed.
lenders.occupational_info: Kathy works at a University, and Yvonne is a massage therapist. and writer.

lenders.name: Jon, Ann, Lucy, & Rosie
lenders.loan_because: Our involvement with InterVarsity Christian Fellowship's "Open for Business" conference in 2006 convinced us of the power of business to be part of God's redeeming influence in the world.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: It is congruent with my heart, mind and soul.
lenders.occupational_info: Empowering youth and teachers to make a meaningful contribution to the health and welfare of people and the planet.  See:  www.iearn.org

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a great way to help people in areas we can't get to ourselves for volunteer work.  And I like that it's a loan, not charity.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people learn to speak professionally to groups of other people in a way that gives them credibility and confidence.

lenders.name: Trevor
lenders.loan_because: Funding business partners around the world seems like a better use of money than buying more useless consumer goods.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a software company, collecting requirements from customers and turning those into product specifications that our developers work from. In my spare time, I ride my bike as fast as possible.

lenders.name: Helen
lenders.loan_because: I am interested in the internet as a force for change.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach english and computer and media studies at a public university.

lenders.name: kristen
lenders.loan_because: What is a small thing for me to give can be a big thing to the one who receives, with ripples that flow out to families and communities.  Thanks to Kiva for making it easy!

lenders.name: NaturalMagic
lenders.loan_because: I put my money where my mouth is.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach.

lenders.name: Donald
lenders.loan_because: It is an easy, productive and empowering way to fight poverty.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: I have seen micro-loans work, and I believe they are suitable instruments for empowering the poor.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a consultant and have  worked on development issues in over 70 countries

lenders.name: Cho
lenders.loan_because:
I really believe that microfinancing is the best way possible to alleviating proverty. It gives them a chance to become self-sufficient without waiting on charity. 

Hopefully the organization you get the loans from also teach you business strategies too.
lenders.occupational_info: I assist lawyers with work.

lenders.name: Jimmy Dunne
lenders.loan_because: This is a great way to help people get out of poverty by starting or expanding a small business.
lenders.occupational_info: I am working to abolish corporal punishment in schools through People Opposed to Paddling Students or POPS in Houston

lenders.name: Mary McKay
lenders.loan_because: because I am delighted to find a way to make a difference in people's lives. It's wonderful to be able to watch the successes of the recipients of the loans.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a writer and a painter.

lenders.name: Bob
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others in their struggles.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an attorney that represents those who cannot afford to hire an attorney when they are accused by the government of wrong doing.

lenders.name: Virginia
lenders.loan_because: I have been given much and in my retirement I am giving back.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a volunteer with Habitat for Humanity, Hospice of the Carolina Foothills, Polk County Resource Council, Thermal Belt Friendship Council.  For some of the above I have a resposible position, for others I do a lot of their "crud" work, (mailouts, errands, etc.), all of which I enjoy and which keeps me  "young"  in spirit. I am in my 80th year.

lenders.name: Babs & Richie
lenders.loan_because: It's such an easy way to help make dreams come true.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I can
lenders.occupational_info: I teach design; studying to teach math.

lenders.name: Shannon
lenders.loan_because: it helps me to feel I'm making a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: Currently my job is that of caring for my children, thankfully mothering is a universal language.

lenders.name: Joe Paris
lenders.loan_because: How can i NOT loan? In our beautiful, abundant world, we must all interdepend upon one another to live well. I loan because I am able to right now, and don't wish to miss this chance to help someone when I can.
lenders.occupational_info: Telling stories to children of all ages is my passion. I visit schools, hospitals, fairs & festivals, families, and anywhere people gather to share stories by LISTENING TO as well as telling stories that are important to folks.  I also write Life Stories / conduct Life Legacy Interviews on Video for people who wish to preser​ve a written / video record of their lives.

lenders.name: Maurice
lenders.loan_because: It is an expression of my religion's highest form of supporting others.  I am Jewish, and in my tradition the most noble form of supporting others is to provide someone with a loan or other resources so that they can achieve economic independence.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a rabbi at a Jewish congregation in the state of Oregon in the U.S.

lenders.name: Kathleen
lenders.loan_because: this method seems to allow individuals an opportunity that otherwise is unavailable through regular financial sources. It makes sense to me!

lenders.name: kirsten
lenders.loan_because: this is simply an amazing idea. everyone should do it. redistributing wealth and involving people from all over the world has answered some of my nagging questions of the unfairness of poverty and an accessible way to help remedy the problem. meaningful, EASY involvement with people from all over the world is yet another reason the world wide web makes me smile.

lenders.name: Augie and Trena
lenders.loan_because: All people, children of God, have a right to basic necessities: food, water, shelter, education, healthcare.
lenders.occupational_info: Augie is a Campus Minister at a Catholic high school.  Trena cares for our two sons and daughter at home.

lenders.name: Justin
lenders.loan_because: I want to empower business owners, give dignity to individuals and communicate God's love for them in a practical way.
lenders.occupational_info: I own my own small business that provides accounting and bookkeeping services.  I am also a pastor at a Christian church.  I believe Jesus loves every human being on Earth and I want to share that love with those I help.

lenders.name: Jim
lenders.loan_because: I feel blessed in my life and I want to give something back

lenders.name: Marin
lenders.occupational_info: I research brain development in children using MRI pictures of their brains.

lenders.name: Carla
lenders.loan_because: My daughter Christina volunteered with "Village Enterprise Fund" in East Africa and showed me first hand the needs of the very poor and their desire to creatively help themselves.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: What a wonderful way to recycle one's money by investing in another's future.  Becoming a part of another's success is a reward beyond the money.
lenders.occupational_info: During my employment years I managed engineers who made equipment operate in a manufacturing business. Today I make furniture, ride a bicycle long distances, volunteer helping children who are at risk.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I want to leave the world better than I found it
lenders.occupational_info: Using the financial markets to manage risk

lenders.name: Derrick
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves an opportunity!
lenders.occupational_info: Humanitarian, Environmental, Lodging, Investment, etc.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: This makes so much sense and a modest amount can mean so much to someone. This is a wonderful idea.

lenders.name: Janet
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a public school teacher in Denver, Colorado, USA. I teach refugee children from all over the world to read English. I love my job and my students.

lenders.name: Nhat
lenders.loan_because: I have profound respect for people who are willing to take responsibility for their own lives but need just a little help toward self-sustenance.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: Giving to Kiva is one of the easiest and most effective ways to help others achieve self sufficiency.

lenders.name: mike
lenders.loan_because: Joining the kiva community is a way of being connected to people in other parts of the world.
lenders.occupational_info: long-term Canadian civil servant - now retired.

lenders.name: Carrie
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach high school social studies in new york.

lenders.name: Kelly
lenders.loan_because: I want to help women entrepreneurs, especially those involved in quilting and the fiber arts.
lenders.occupational_info: I write books, and also write for magazines, websitesm and businesses.

lenders.name: Terrie
lenders.loan_because: my children have never gone hungry.  Kiva is a great way to offer direct help to people who are struggling with the day to day problems that come with poverty.  It helps me express my gratitude.
lenders.occupational_info: I do office work for non-profit land trust and I do a lot of work with and for my church,

lenders.name: Anupam
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: Systems Engineering is what you get when you mix a lot of science and expertise with a bit of 'autmagik'!

lenders.name: Troy
lenders.loan_because: It's a way to help others help themselves and, with any luck, those around them.
lenders.occupational_info: I negotiate the paperwork for commercial transactions (mostly involving the transfer of business loans between lenders).

lenders.name: Randy
lenders.occupational_info: I am a researcher and network operations architect in my day job.  I have spent my spare time in the last 20 years bringing the internet to academics in the poorest countries.

lenders.name: Taylor
lenders.loan_because: Presently with more money than I need and having lived at various stages of wealth, I understand that encouragement, economic or otherwise, goes a long way when combined with initiative.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as an editor and writer, most recently in the book publishing industry. On good days I use more than just my head.

lenders.name: AlzheimersScreen.com
lenders.loan_because: , as Ken Kesey said, "Put your good where it will do the most".
lenders.occupational_info: Automated touch screen tests for cognitive changes that predict Alzheimer's disease.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: empowering people to provide for themselves and their communities is the most important and sustainable aid I as an idividual can provide.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a professional orchestral clarinetist! My job is to rehearse and perform incredible pieces of music. You can't beat that.

lenders.name: William
lenders.loan_because: I have been on medical missions and have seen the need of people first hand.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an obstetrician employed by a large regional medical center. Our group of 4 takes care of pregnant women who are uninsured, illegal, poor, etc. who present to the hospital in labor. We also run a free clinic.

lenders.name: Dinny
lenders.loan_because: After reading Hillary Clinton's Autobiography I was very interested in Micro-loans. Borrowing a little of our money is so valuable in these economies, to these individuals. Nicholas Kristof's column in the NYT made it real.
lenders.occupational_info: I've worked with animals for my whole life; everything from owning a goat dairy to training hunting dogs,wolves and dressage horses. I teach people to be in sync with the critters that share our lives, In other words I'm an animal trainer (people trainer).

lenders.name: Sol
lenders.loan_because: Microlending is the quintessential example of globalization and capitalism's "good side". Because it relies on individual achievement and self-help, it is to me enormously fascinating and rewarding.

lenders.name: Sai & Kalyan
lenders.loan_because: I want to extend a helping hand to those who are less fortunate than I am and because I hope someday those I help will themselves be in a position  to help others.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: Initially started as a group project for college in 2007.

lenders.name: Lou & Debra
lenders.loan_because: Debra and I have been blessed with many things. We wish to help others so that one day they too can achieve their hopes and dreams.

lenders.name: Ray Iannicelli
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Bill & Marielle
lenders.loan_because: Lending allows hard working people to retain their self respect by being able to re pay the loan.

lenders.name: Eva
lenders.loan_because:
I want to help. These people have business ideas and are willing to work hard and the only obstacle is a small amount of cash. I love the idea that these small businesses give back to their communities through services they provide and - more importantly - through creating jobs. 

In my line of work I read a lot about macroeconomic conditions in developing countries, World Bank initiatives, etc, but I believe that a grass roots campaign like Kiva's and simple microfinance is crucial in helping people break away from poverty.
 
I admire courage and commitment of all people with entrapreneurial spirit, but helping SMALL entrapreneurs AND in poor countries has almost transcendental dimension. I guess, ultimately, it is self gratifying....
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a small brokerage firm as an emerging markets analyst.

lenders.name: Agilitas
lenders.loan_because: I wish to practice the love of Christ and help humanity as long as I exist.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an owner of a software product and consulting firm.

lenders.name: Matthew
lenders.loan_because: I respect the entrepreneurial spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in advertising sales for WKRN-TV/ News 2 in Nashville, TN

lenders.name: Nicholas
lenders.loan_because: I know a little bit of capital will unlock creative entrepreneurial spirit and muster resources in profound ways that will quickly improve lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I volunteer for National Public Radio service.

lenders.name: Lorraine
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people who are not as fortunate as I am and help to make their lives better.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as an administrative assistant supporting four bankers in a financial services institution in New York City.

lenders.name: Erin
lenders.loan_because: I've achieved many things in my life with the support of others, and having worked in Africa realize how little opportunity there is for assistance of this kind.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on the communications team for an international public health organization.

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: This is a great idea and a great opportunity for all of us. So let´s see, if it works.
lenders.occupational_info:
I´m a teacher in a vocational school in Munich, Germany.
My subjects are Protestant Religion and Technical English.

lenders.name: Linsey
lenders.loan_because: Every little bit counts!

lenders.name: William and Gaylan
lenders.loan_because: We believe in investing in people...and everyone needs help from time to time.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a corporate Dilbert in a cubicle.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I believe in capitalism, and I admire people who have the courage to start their own business.  I respect people who work hard to support their family...............  Voluntary private help is more efficient & less corrupt than "foreign aid."  Forget the UN and IMF -- we can help each other without them.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: It works!  A microloan to an enterprising person enables them to better their own situation and that of their community.  It confers a level of dignity that a donation does not.

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: I believe in giving while helping others less fortunate than I.

lenders.name: Evan
lenders.loan_because: I believe that micro-loans can change lives by empowering others to effect the change through their the borrower's own work and entrepreneurial spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: I build websites and applications for a nonprofit organization that provides practical training opportunities in the United States for foreign students and young professionals.

lenders.name: Laurie
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: The Garapicks
lenders.loan_because: We want to help others.

lenders.name: Sheryl
lenders.loan_because: I've been luckier than most
lenders.occupational_info: I make investments in companies and take care of my children

lenders.name: Ray
lenders.loan_because: I've been very lucky to have been born here in the United States, with a loving family and great opportunities that I've never taken for granted.  I give because I want others have to the same chance to improve their lives, support their families, and follow their dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: I design websites, much like the one you are looking at right now.  I choose the colors, fonts, and the layout that I hope will look pleasing to the eye, as well as properly showing the information.  I also write and perform music.

lenders.name: Myron
lenders.loan_because: I have received help from others and want to see others get the chance to succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I build houses and rent them.

lenders.name: Graham
lenders.loan_because:
I was first inspired and moved by two people - one is Muhammad Yunus who most of you'll be familiar with and the second is Greg Mortenson.

I wonder how I can give something back. It is a great feeling to get rid of that cash - it's almost like a liberation to give such a small amount to someone for whom it makes such a big difference.

As lenders we need to network and work together to make sure that this goes beyond lending money. Even as Muhammad Yunus said - that charity denies people dignity - so we need to get together and start taking this to the next level - give a man a fish or teach him to fish... 

gbrown@w2forum.com
lenders.occupational_info: Telecoms & Real Estate. But that's only given me the chance to make a difference. The real work starts by giving all that back to others...

lenders.name: JIM
lenders.loan_because: During my lifetime of 78 years, so far, I have worked at many jobs from iron miner, trench digger, welder, business manager and attorney.   I received help along the way from many good people and now that I am retired I keep busy buying and selling items and educational e-books on ebay. You can see an example of an e-book on my website and i will send it free to any Kiva borrower who wishes to start a similar business. I will be using the ebay profits to make loans to people thru Kiva.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired from my practice of law where I helped clients in business, and family issues.

lenders.name: Abe Louise
lenders.loan_because: it is thrilling. Solidarity, not charity!
lenders.occupational_info: Writing for a better world, inside my heart and outside my front door. Educating teenagers around the globe!

lenders.name: Eduardo
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference, and I know how fortunate I am that I can make these loans

lenders.name: Ian
lenders.loan_because: Kiva's system makes so much sense, is easy to use, and it is one way to repay what I have gained from the generosity of others.
lenders.occupational_info: Editing historical documents for publication

lenders.name: Josh
lenders.loan_because: current development models are stale, its time for innovation, creativity, and giving more trust to people in developing countries to lead development programming in their own communities.
lenders.occupational_info: I have been involved in global health research and analysis since I was a PCV in Mali, from 2000-2002.  Although my focus is on water/sanitation issues, health like all other development issues, are interconnected with better outcomes for other parts of an individual's life.

lenders.name: Loren and Mistie
lenders.loan_because: We want to help

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: I am inspired by entrepreneurs in developing countries!

lenders.name: dede & marko
lenders.loan_because: we're delighted to have found this creative way to give back and to help make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Joan
lenders.loan_because: It's such a small thing for me to do that gets big results for others.

lenders.name: Richard
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed in many ways.  I think the loans I make through Kiva is one good way to share my blessings with others in need.
lenders.occupational_info: Although retired, I still am active as an Episcopal priest.  I sometimes lead worship and preach.  I often consult with leaders of congregations to help them with challenges in their community's life.  Beyond that, I frequently get involved in local political issues, trying to make our city a better place for all its citizens.  My wife and I also try to spend time with our nine grandchildren, and we like to travel to distant places and see things and meet people different from those at home.

lenders.name: syndallas
lenders.loan_because: I want to increase kindness, love, and peace in the world.  I see people with such great ideas and I want to see them happen!
lenders.occupational_info: I care for my two sons, husband and home.  I teach science at my son's school.

lenders.name: Mike & Bridget
lenders.loan_because: the opportunity to earn an economic living is the greatest equalizer in our world.

lenders.name: Shenkiat
lenders.loan_because: You gotta do what you gotta do.

lenders.name: Marvin
lenders.loan_because: I feel fortunate to be able make a difference in another persons life.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: I think that Kiva is a brilliant idea. I believe that given a chance people can, and will do the most amazing things.

lenders.name: Kazel
lenders.loan_because: I am so lucky to have all that I have in my life, and I want to give back for that.  I want to help others who haven't been so lucky.  Kiva is one good way. It is such a great opportunity to reach out to other people and make a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English at a community college in Austin.  I teach composition and literature classes to about 150 students a semester.  It's a great job!

lenders.name: Nathanael
lenders.loan_because: This is an incredible idea and I want to be a part of it.

lenders.name: Suzy
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: robert
lenders.loan_because: I want to help those who will help themselvs
lenders.occupational_info: I am a writer

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: I have more than I need and I know that beyond "enough," having more brings no happiness.  Sharing does.

lenders.name: marian
lenders.loan_because: i want to do my part to help my fellow man/woman. i wouldnt be where i am without the help of kind strangers. i am returning the favor.
lenders.occupational_info: healthcare field

lenders.name: Dana& Hugh
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance to support themselves and their family.

lenders.name: Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: I am truly inspired by the stories and dedication of the entrepreneurs I see on KIVA. I hope that what I am able to share does make a difference in someone's life.

lenders.name: Linda Sue
lenders.loan_because: small acts of grace put together are so much more powerful than giant corporation and foundations can ever be.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for executives managing the details of their lives; in my "real" life, I am a wife, pet owner and actor.

lenders.name: Dan
lenders.loan_because: Making a connection with the world  : )

lenders.name: bart
lenders.loan_because: I care and giving to someone who is trying to lift themselves up feels good and feels right. I truly wish these people the best. If my contribution has even a small positive impact on one life it is worth it.
lenders.occupational_info: I design networks that transport data, voice and video.

lenders.name: Barbara
lenders.loan_because: I can!
lenders.occupational_info: I have gone back to university after working for 32 years in health care.  I feel richly blessed and think that we should all help each other so there is no more war!!

lenders.name: Philip/Thelma
lenders.loan_because: having lived overseas, we know how much small gifts can do to make for large results in the lives of others.
lenders.occupational_info: We now volunteer our services to our local library, and we work at being good grandparents.

lenders.name: Joanne
lenders.loan_because: I grew a business as a single mom, and I know how much it would have mattered to have financial help
lenders.occupational_info: My company sews custom draperies and other items for interior designers

lenders.name: Katherine
lenders.loan_because: I know micro-credit works to help people otherwise unable to get credit achieve their dreams and goals.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for local government and volunteer for several local non-profits related to land protection, sustainability and supporting at risk children

lenders.name: Tracey
lenders.loan_because: It's completely unacceptable to be living so well in the US and not give back to others.  I like the idea of helping others who are trying their best to make ends meet.  This is a great program!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a special education teacher, which means I work with children who may need a little more help to learn something new.  I enjoy my job because the children are adorable and I can be creative.

lenders.name: Eric
lenders.loan_because: I've got money coming out of my ears.  It's actually kinda gross, and sometimes I can't hear very well with all of it crammed in there.  Don't worry, though - I wash off the ear wax before I lend it.

lenders.name: Mei
lenders.loan_because: I think Microfinancing is the most sustainable way to improve the world and fight poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: I help companies improve efficiencies and keep cost down in their supply chain.

lenders.name: Chico SML
lenders.loan_because: We want to end poverty around the world and we believe that micro-lending is the best tool for this. We are working for a world free of poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: Students For Micro-Lending is an organization on the Chico State campus. We are fundraising in order to make micro-loans to people in need around the world.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: I believe it is my responsibility to help others help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: Preserve the built environment worth saving, and design new places of beauty and significance.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I'm lucky enough to be better off than the people who need the loans.

lenders.name: Molly
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Patricia & Wayne
lenders.loan_because: We admire the entrepreneurial spirit! We also feel we are fortunate and would like to help others pursue their goals.
lenders.occupational_info: We create small games for internet sites.

lenders.name: Rob
lenders.loan_because: What a great idea!

lenders.name: Frank
lenders.loan_because:
WE can change the world.
Lets make it a better place for all. NOW !

lenders.name: Gideon
lenders.loan_because: Microfinance is the solution to extreme poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: I am in school studying International Relations.

lenders.name: Claudia
lenders.loan_because: It gives me great joy to share in this way and  I am very grateful to  those who have made this such an easy process.

lenders.name: Potter Family
lenders.loan_because: To help close the income gap.
lenders.occupational_info: IT

lenders.name: Barb
lenders.loan_because: There are so many hard-working people who can't get loans from a bank no matter how great their business plans. It is these folks whom I can help through Kiva!
lenders.occupational_info: I own a technology consulting business.

lenders.name: MBAs Without Borders
lenders.loan_because: MBAs Without Borders donates on behalf of it's MBA volunteers a set amount for every month they have worked in the field.  In the future we hope to provide this option to our at home volunteers.
lenders.occupational_info:
MBAs Without Borders (MWB) was founded in Canada in 2004. In 2006, MWB sent 10 MBAs and worked in 11 countries. To put that into perspective, we sent only 1 MBA in all of 2005.

Our mission is to contribute to the business and social development of upcoming nations through work rotations of MBA professionals.

Moving forward, we are very excited for 2007 as we expect to send 20 to 25 MBAs from around the globe (North & South) to over 15 new countries on projects that will bring light to new communities in India, bring better health care to locals in Pakistan, Zimbabwe and South Africa, build up fair trade markets in Rwanda and Ethiopia and our MBAs will continue to help build up micro finance institutions across Africa…all this and more as we continuing to…develop people and nations! 

In general, we develop projects within five industries: Healthcare, Agriculture, Financial, Income-Generation and Climate Change. Within these industries, we partner MBAs with local businesses, international businesses and NGOs working to not only develop businesses, but also…people and nations!

lenders.name: Alison
lenders.loan_because: The current state of the world often seems hopeless with so much prejudice and hatred.  Sometimes it seems that we are helpless to change things.  This program allows me to reach out to someone in another part of the world and become a partner in something positive.  It allows me as an individual to make a difference for someone else. I want to do what I can to have a positive cultural exchange and to make someone's world a little bit better.
lenders.occupational_info: I live in Rome, Italy and I teach English here to adults and to children.

lenders.name: Toby
lenders.loan_because: Although I am only about a month old I want to make a difference in the world I just joined.
lenders.occupational_info: To drink milk, not cry too much and let my parents sleep and enjoy my cuteness

lenders.name: Michele
lenders.loan_because: I know what it is like when you have dreams but not the means to realise them.

lenders.name: Hazel
lenders.loan_because: What a wonderful opportunity to be involved in the lives of others.
lenders.occupational_info: Enabling connections in the community for positive outcomes

lenders.name: warren
lenders.loan_because: People need money to improve their lives
lenders.occupational_info: I teach teenagers to speak Spanish

lenders.name: Kathleen
lenders.loan_because: This is such a great idea, I had to do it.  Providing small business owners in the developing world with access to the capital they need to grow their businesses and change their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I recently opened a tutoring and college test-prep firm.  Getting funding in the U.S. right now is very difficult, unfortunately the micro-finance model wouldn't work here (or so they tell me), so we're at the mercy of banks who won't lend to anyone right now.

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.occupation: Bank Risk Analyst / Single Mom of 1 Child
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference in a person's life. I think everyone has been in the situation of needing help and being able to provide that for someone else makes me happy.
lenders.occupational_info: I look at bank processes related to credit risk. Then, I recommend ways to reduce those risks.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: It's a small way of giving back to those who are less fortunate.

lenders.name: Lauren and Josh
lenders.loan_because: I am lucky to have been born in a rich country where I have had many advantages.  It makes me happy to help people who were born into less fortunate circumstances.  I hope that my small loans can help people improve their lives and communities.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a counselor, so I sit and talk with people and help them with their problems.   My husband makes video games.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: The chance to help someone become self-sufficient and at the same time help a developing economy at the grassroots level is a chance that shouldnt be overlooked.

lenders.name: Maureen
lenders.loan_because: I am very lucky to have a pretty easy life.  I am happy to help someone attain their goals.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: To give hope to another woman.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell used books online (by computer) and ship them from my barn in California.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: I live in a country with a ridiculous abundance of resources, some of which I have been privileged enough to get my hands on.  I don't see why others shouldn't be able to get access to some of what I'm not using...
lenders.occupational_info: I am trying to understand how receiving information about the traits that we inherit from our parents might change the way that we think about our health.

lenders.name: Joan Coil Carvalho
lenders.loan_because: Born in St.Paul Minnesota,USA,  I worked, married, and lived in Lima. Peru for 8 years;  followed by 4 years working and living in Montevideo,Uruguay.  I learned how hard most people must work for the basic necessities, so continue to  try to the best of my ability to help.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired, but still follow international affairs.  I very much appreciate Kiva that allows me to participate in a small, but hopefully, important program.

lenders.name: Andrew
lenders.occupational_info: I am currently a University of Pittsburgh student.

lenders.name: Sherry
lenders.loan_because: Some things you just can't quantify...like "emotional returns."

lenders.name: Warren
lenders.loan_because: For so many donations, you write a check and forget about it - you don't know if your money went to help someone in need or to buy a keg for the office picnic.  Here you see the faces and uses of those you help.  Its also a loan - not a donation - that can be rolled over to help others in need.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: I want to do what I can to help improve people's lives

lenders.name: Fran
lenders.loan_because: It is right.
lenders.occupational_info: I work to enforce environmental laws for the state of Ohio in the US.  I also am an avocational bookbinder and appreciate the hard work and dedication necessary to develop any kind of craft business.

lenders.name: Vanessa
lenders.loan_because: Kiva speaks to my heart.

lenders.name: Catherine
lenders.loan_because: I loan because I have enough money to share with people who need it.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach 6,7 and 8 year old children.

lenders.name: Bob & Terri
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we can and because it might make a lasting difference.  Lending puts human faces on distant and abstract issues.  Perhaps most of all, we make loans like this because we saw our parents do the same for people they met along the way.
lenders.occupational_info: Terri and Bob are both educators in North Carolina. Terri teaches high school. Her students have Autism and she prepares them for college.  Bob teaches at a university about social movements and organizations that work to empower people to overcome inequalities.

lenders.name: Sabra
lenders.loan_because: Because I know that I am not well paid by American standards, but live richly in the view of the rest of the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with pregnant women who are having some difficulties, such as drug use, homelessness, domestic violence and teenagers.  I try to help them have healthy pregnancies and healthy babies, and to be good parents.
